intro: Microcos seretii, commonly known as the African sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Microcos seretii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
